column3: Concept ACK - Thanks for looking into this, and the patching looks reasonable. As I [said in #22074](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22074#issuecomment-871337482):\n> I can't imagine we are going to block migrating to std::filesystem based on our Qt version being too old, to support building against a new enough version of the Android NDK to support std::filesystem. I'd rather just drop

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
tACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/464c46d4dea028c8e9bcfc2e0abfd171238075ea\nBuilt on CI, APK works fine on a device. Thanks @hebasto!

Updated 464c46d4dea028c8e9bcfc2e0abfd171238075ea -> acaac6e86a9e808244d9c69a59ab3c2d8e34cad6 ([pr22469.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22469.02) -> [pr22469.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22469.03)):

- rebased due to the conflict with #20641
- addressed @icota's and @fanquake's [comments](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22469#discussion_r671786517)
Nice ! This is a much needed change, will test on 23 to see if it works as well

`+=` operator here unlike `=` in other `TARGET_ARCHES` above? \n\nPersonally I'd get rid of `mips` as it's no longer suppored and to make the patchfile that much smaller.
mips acrhs are removed in Qt 5.13 (https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/854156dd07ca5d50db9be091d34f68b9ca02ff21), but that commit is orthogonal to the issue solved here.
> `+=` operator here unlike `=` in other `TARGET_ARCHES` above?\n\nThanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22469#issuecomment-881861647).

> Personally I'd get rid of mips as it's no longer suppored and to make the patchfile that much smaller.\n\nInclined to agree with @icota here. In any case, if mips support was removed in 5.13, and the patch here is from 5.14, why does it contain anything mips related? If you've added that to the patch yourself, why isn't that mentioned / documented anywhere?

Agree.

> Personally I'd get rid of `mips` as it's no longer suppored and to make the patchfile that much smaller.

> Inclined to agree with @icota here.

[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22469#issuecomment-882055056).
